title: Field Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Great position coaching and reviewing teacher candidates. The management and communication are a bit loose and disorganized but this is a wonderful place for a self-starter. Sadly, the program is being terminated in June 2023.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Firstly, introduced myself and described my related working experience, then the professor gave me a project and an essay to grade, as well as giving suggestions on those works. Finally send back the greaded one and wait for decision
Interview Questions: Please introduce yourself, and address relative working experience.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: 1 week long and get an interview by the director. i have not finish the process pls dont ask what have i done ok? 30words to go. why me? why me?
Interview Questions: not yet get answer from department

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I sent in an application for the lab, along with my resume. I was interviewed via zoom a few days later, and I heard back a few days after that.
Interview Questions: What have you learned from your past experiences and your time at Brandeis that you can contribute to the lab?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Interesting questions and so on and so forth. Great culture. I worked with the economics department who are all very nice and cooperative, and especially good at their jobs
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength

title: Content Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Took about a month for anyone to reach out to initiate the process. Once someone reached out they were pretty quick at setting up a call. After the call there was a request for additional materials and then dropped communication. No follow-up to indicate thanks but no thanks.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard interview questions. Tell us about your experience, etc.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA)
Interview Descriptions: You come to campus for a day and meet with 4-5 faculty members for about 30 minutes each. Usually, there are breaks in the day for lunch. Most faculty will have a fairly casual conversation with you, ask you about your interests, experience, etc. Some may hit you with a typical interview question such as "What has been you greatest failure and what did you learn?"
Interview Questions:
What did you study in Undergrad and why?

What research experience do you have?

Are you familiar with (insert faculty member from you undergraduate university here)'s work?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed via phone for a first round interview and via Zoom for a second round half day interview. Held with various areas of the campus community. Very welcoming and positive interactions.
Interview Questions: What is your advisement/leadership style?

title: On Campus Job Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Clear communication beforehand, a friendly and welcoming atmosphere, well-prepared interviewers who ask thoughtful questions, and a chance for the candidate to ask their own questions. The process was also efficient, with timely communication and a clear timeline for next steps.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about yourself? Why are you interested in this position/ company? What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Sr. Department Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed through zoom with two interviewers.  We Started on time and finished within 45 mins.  Interviewers are very professional, they introduce themselves, the position and the campus as a whole.  For this position, we only did one round interview.  And i also got invited to visit the campus in person before I make my final decision.
Interview Questions:
Introduce self.
2-3 experience based detailed questions 
2-3 behavioral question

title: Undergraduate Admissions Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: First round conducted by fellow undergraduates who work at the office. They were very nice and welcoming. Second round conducted by office staff who was very sweet. Overall pleasant interview process.
Interview Questions: Who is your favorite professor?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3-4 Zoom interviews. Meet the team. Questions on position. Questions on resume. Questions on goals. Every team member asks you questions. How would you do this and that? What di you recommend type questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want the job?

title: Residential Life Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, progressive, diverse. They allow time to think & are very smiley.  It certainly makes you feel very confident. I have no complaints here, and think they asked good questions
Interview Questions:
Why this job?
what will you bring?
What do you wish to get from it?

title: Area Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: This was a three round interview with the current team. There was a variety of question that helped them identify if I was a good fit for the team. It was a comfortable and engaging experience.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my supervisory style

title: Personal Banker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: It was a very cool place to interview with I like to interview. Interviewing is great, very easy to interview. I am just thankful for a shot of interviewing That is it, thank you
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in ten years

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brandeis University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard. First round was a phone interview. I actually didn't make it past the first round, but the most frustrating part was instead of letting me know, they just ghosted me. I found that very disconcerting from an allegedly renowned university.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with Excel?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: It was a one-day interview process with individual 30 minute interviews from roughly 5 professors, and an hour long interview with your PI of interest. The interviews were extremely conversational and did not feel high-pressure.
Interview Questions: If you could design the perfect study for your topic of interest, what would it be?

title: Performer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Had a nice short interview with coordinator at Rose Art Museum. It was for an art exhibit that needed performers. My only real complaint about this process is that the person I interviewed with said they'd let me know the following wednesday but I did not hear back with my rejection until the day before/of the shows. I wish companies had more respect for those they interview to reject the same day or not long after as the people the accept.
Interview Questions: Asked about my experience, reason for interest, availability

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: I got this opportunity at a networking convention where I applied through a specialized link. I applied online and got an interview on-sight after doing HireVue test. Mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Good and smooth. Felt very comfortable and relaxed. Little bit of anxiety but otherwise nothing to overly stress or worry about. No other words to describe the interview process.
Interview Questions: Good

title: Student Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Was called in for interview after applying through on-campus portal, got the job within two days of the interview. I was in a small and quiet board room with my interviewer who would later be my supervisor. We talked about daily tasks, mostly administrative work, and then there was an opportunity for me to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself.

title: Phonathon Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: easy short interview. Mainly asked about past experience and sales abliity. Asked very basic questions with last question somewhat difficult. Asked to sell a journal to interviewer with 1 minue preperation. Interview lasted no more than 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Sell me this diary, you have one minute to prepare.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the postdoctoral research associate position via referral of my PhD advisor. I gave a presentation of my PhD research and then talked to all group members as well as other researchers in the department for about 15-20mins each.
Interview Questions: The main questions in my interview is about my previous research projects.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: should send application to the professor including resume and cover letter. In cover letter, you should  about your past experience in accordance with the position and illustrate your career interest. The professor would select and send you the confirmation, making sure your availability.
Interview Questions: why this position  why you

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: The professor will evaluate your last year's performance in the class you will be TAing this year. Then he/she will decide whether you are qualified or not to TA this class.
Interview Questions: How do you answer a student's question when you don't actually know the answer

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview, with 2 people. Questions were mostly related to the experience and why I think I would succeed in the role, why I am interested in the role, what challenges do I expect and what part of the job I have never done before.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of your creative thinking at work?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: They seem to do a lot of hiring by committee, so I met with a few individuals and then a couple of groups of people. From being on the other side of the interview process later on your personality mattered more than your actual skillset, which worked okay for me, but I could see how that could be frustrating for others.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your ability to juggle multiple projects at once

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a phone interview which went very well.  The interviewer asked typical first round interview questions such as why are you interested in this position, what strengths would you bring to this position, etc.  The interview flowed more as a conversation rather than an interview which was comforting.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Department Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brandeis University in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was offered a phone interview within 24 hours of submitting an application; was offered an in-person interview 4 days after submitting the online application.  The phone interview was a conference call, and they were trying to move very quickly through the process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?  How do you react in high interruption environments?

title: Senior Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA)
Interview Descriptions:
Initial interview was with hiring manager.  Good open and honest discussion about the job and it's  challenges.  
Took awhile to hear back but manager did eventually follow up that they had offerred job to someone else.
Interview Questions: typical background questions to share my background and experience

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: I emailed a professor asking if there was a research technician position available.  Two weeks later I heard back and was brought in. I was a first year undergraduate student at the time, and they knew I had limited research experience.  The interview focused on if I was willing to be trained.  You won't necessarily be paid unless you have work study depending on the lab's funding, but the research experience is invaluable
Interview Questions: Do you have work study?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fine. Nothing too difficult. It was a face to face interview with the manager that lasted about 45 minutes. Only 1 round, which is the face to face interview. They let me know within 2 weeks and I started working right away.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time you worked in a group and what role you took in the group work?

title: Escort Safety Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Submit online application, pretty straightforward, check your drivers license - unless you have a terrible driving record or are really bad at talking to people it should not be challenging.
Interview Questions: how long have you held a drivers license

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took about three weeks from the time I submitted my resume to the time I was offered the job. The staff was kind and friendly. There are many opportunities to develop at Brandeis.
Interview Questions: General questions. Panel interview

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Very traditional interview. Friendly staff. Behavioral interview questions. Provided positive feedback during the interview to help the candidate. Interviewers had spent time reviewing the resume and took the process seriously. On-site interview included rounds with a few different staff members in small groups, and included a few minutes with the SVP.
Interview Questions: If a prospective student was choosing between attending Brandeis and attending the school you went to, how would you advise them?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: The Graduate research team leader came to our class actually. Because I am a computer science student and the I was taking 3d animation class. The research that I am doing is directly related to computer science so the professor came to our class telling us about the opportunity. Then there was an in person interview after a week. Then they told me after three weeks that I had gotten the job. Then I had to do some paper work, formalities that the school requires new worker. After the paper work I was good to go. The process was quick.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this?

title: Special Projects Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: the interview was actually really easy. I waited about a week to hear about my online application, got an interview, and at the interview they only asked a few basic questions and then asked about my availability.
Interview Questions: Are you punctual?

title: LMS Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Boston, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I had a 45 minute phone interview, and was immediately selected for the contract position.  The Associate Director interviewed me for this position.  They wanted to know about my background, my comfort level with Moodle, my consultation experiences.

I shared my experiences, and gave examples from some of my past projects.  It was a pleasant experience, and truly enjoyed the process.  I enjoyed speaking about my experiences, and the conversation flowed very easily.  I did not get stumped by any questions.  I felt they wanted to gauge my knowledge and experiences.  Also they requested to submit an e-portfolio or work samples.
Interview Questions:
My experience with Moodle, and my instructional design skills.
Particularly they wanted to find out my comfort level with Moodle LMS and all its tools. 
Elaborate on Past Projects
Examples from difficult situations in job
Elaborate my client base
LMS skills  (Experience with other LMS)
Multimedia Skills (Photoshop, Illustrator, blogs)
People Skills

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Advisors and one on one meetings with current students in the lab, where they give you a overview and you are encouraged to ask as many questions as possible. You are asked to give a talk about own research and bonus point if you can relate it to work going on currently in the lab. Three reference letters were required.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals?

title: Equity Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: First give a behavioral interview and then process to an online test.The behavioral questions are about your basic mathematical intuition and may be give you a tiny case to solve. However, the online test seems very strict. I believed I finished them all correctly however I still did not meet the minimum requirement.
Interview Questions: some numerical questions

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first indicated which Professors I was interested in working with.  I had a 30 minute interview which each of them at their offices, and then met with the other potential graduate students.
Interview Questions: Describe the research that you conducted during your time as an undergraduate.

title: PhD Graduate Student - Biology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Thursday night dinner with students. Friday (all day) interviews with 4-6 faculty, attend a class and seminar, and a departmental social. Friday night dinner with faculty and students. Saturday possible outing to Boston depending on weather.
Interview Questions: What is your prior experience.

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview done by a representative from the human resources department. In person interview conducted a week or so later. Hiring process took a few week before an offer was made.
Interview Questions: Questions were actually very simple.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Brandeis University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Each department at Brandeis does its own internal hiring so the interview process will be very different department to department. I applied online and received an e-mail a few days later with an interview request. Very quick 20 minute interview - job offer two days later.
Interview Questions: Resume run through

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: good, all people was nice, interview was awesome but then anything is truth althought after a long time all expenses were covered. you have quite a  lot flexibility to start work which is good, especially if you have to come oveseas
Interview Questions: how long I would like to be in here

title: Digital Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions:
Brandeis University provides students with the opportunities of a world-class research university in the intimate setting of a small liberal arts college just a few miles from downtown Boston. We truly believe we blend the best of both worlds.
Consistently ranked among the nation’s best universities, Brandeis is widely recognized for the excellence of its faculty and the quality and diversity of its student body.
Interview Questions: The university was named for the late Louis D. Brandeis, the first Jewish Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court, and it was shaped by the ideals he represented: passion for learning, commitment to social justice and equality, individual rights and concern for the world.

title: TEACHERS ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I was approached by the professor. No interview required.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brandeis University
Interview Descriptions: One interview, very simple process. Also required one professor reccomendation, 3 hour training, mostly learning about tutoring styles
Interview Questions: Had me tutor something to the interviewer

title: Department Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Process involves at least 3 days, and interviews with 6 or more people. It can be very time consuming if you are transitioning into a new career, but is typical for higher ed.
Interview Questions: Not a question but a suggestion: sending thank you notes here is very important. It is expected that you send a personalized thank you note to every person you meet with, from the HR phone screening to the Department Director.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA)
Interview Descriptions: After some email and phone exchanges, I came over for a day, meet the people, discussed science.
Interview Questions: It was not  like a test, so question N/A/

title: Brandeis National Committee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brandeis University in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 interviews.  One over the phone and one in person with hiring committee. After second interview they asked me to submit a writing sample, but never called me back.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Contacted for an interview with another lab employee.  Made it sound like it would be the full interview with the PI.  This was note the case, it was merely a screen.  They were just using it to weed out applicants.  Utter waste of time.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience managing the financials of a lab?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview involved presentation, interview with PI and lab people. During lunch, I had an opportunity to hear about good residence near Brandeis and working hours in the lab and work environment. Housing and food were ok.
Interview Questions: Which project in the lab was I interested?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Wrote to PI, had a phone call, came over, spent one day at Brandeis.  Gave a talk, spoke to other people in lab, had dinner with PI.  Fairly typical postdoc interview process.  Hadn't had any contact with PI before emailing him.  Came from a different field.  He was interested in expanding lab toward the type a work I did before (slightly).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join the lab?

title: Technology Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was first contacted by email to setup a phone screen. Went through this process and a month later was contacted for in-person interview. This went well with individual and panel interviews. Was then contacted for a second in-person a couple weeks later. Went through all that and then waited over 2 weeks. No response from the department either way. This was the worst part; not knowing. Seems disrespectful and callous to put someone through this process and then offer no response at all.
Interview Questions: How do you managerial skills dovetail with your financial knowledge?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: You join several other candidates on campus for a couple of days and are led around by current grad students, but only one of them is technically for the interview. The rest is for socializing and getting to know the university. The interviews themselves consist of meeting with 4 faculty members, where you have a conversation with them about the school, your background, and their research. It's informal, but intimidating.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit in one of our labs?

title: Van Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: They made me drive around for a while to see if I could drive. They asked me basic questions. It was super easy. I wouldn't worry about it unless you can't drive.
Interview Questions: Can you drive?

title: Department Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had a brief phone screening and then was brought in to interview with 4 members of the department. Brought back again to meet with 2 more members.
Interview Questions: So, this is your first real job.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview was on site, where I met with everyone in the lab individually, and I gave an one hour presentation of my graduate student work.  Everyone was very friendly and put me to ease for the process.
Interview Questions: Being told after starting the job that I should move closer to be able to spend more time in the lab.

title: Administrative  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was very informative of the culture and benefits.
Interview Questions: q

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: My communications were surprisingly short.  I suspect my advisor made up his mind about me before I had come out for an interview.  It was a typical interview:  a day of meetings with other postdocs, a 40 minute talk.  Everyone was polite and had good things to say about Brandeis.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brandeis University (Waltham, MA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume, and talked with my future employer. We discussed the position, my interests, and my qualificiations.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?
